net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context

Class CompilationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context.CompilationInfo

  • public class CompilationInfo
extends Object
    A utility class that helps to collect source information records and compilation errors while compiling a module.
    Author:
    Robi Malik, Tom Levy, Roger Su

      • add

        public SourceInfo add(Object target,
                      Proxy source)
        Records source information without bindings for the given target.
        Parameters:
        target - The output object to receive source information.
        source - The input object to be associated with the target. If the compilation info contains source information for the source, then the source's source object will be associated with the target.
        Returns:
        The created source information record, or null if source information is disabled.

      • add

        public SourceInfo add(Object target,
                      Proxy source,
                      BindingContext context)
        Records source information with bindings for the given target.
        Parameters:
        target - The output object to receive source information.
        source - The input object to be associated with the target. If the compilation info contains source information for the source, then the source's source object will be associated with the target.
        context - The binding context with the values of any foreach-block variables at the time this output is created.
        Returns:
        The created source information record, or null if source information is disabled.

      • createSourceInfo

        public SourceInfo createSourceInfo(Proxy source,
                                   BindingContext context)
        Creates or retrieves a source information record without recording it. If the given source has associated source information, the source's source information is returned, otherwise a new source information record is created. The parent and context information are combined from the source's source information, the argument, and the currently set parent (mParentSourceInfo), but presently at least one of the combined values must be null. The created source information and can be filed later using add(Object, SourceInfo).
        Parameters:
        source - The input object to be associated with the target. If the compilation info contains source information for the source, then the source's source object will be used in the created source information.
        context - The binding context with the values of any foreach-block variables at the time this output is created, or null to use the context of the source's source.
        Returns:
        A source information record, even if source information is disabled.

      • add

        public void add(Object target,
                SourceInfo info)

      • getResultMap

        public Map<Object,SourceInfo> getResultMap()

      • getSourceInfo

        public SourceInfo getSourceInfo(Object target)

      • getErrorLocation

        public Proxy getErrorLocation(Proxy culprit)
        Returns the location of an error message to be associated with the given output object. This method finds a root source object, i.e., and object within the originally compiled module that can be flagged with an error in the editor.
        Parameters:
        culprit - The object that caused the error.
        Returns:
        The object in the original input module that can be flagged; or the argument if source information is disabled or could not be found for the argument.

      • pushParentSourceInfo

        public SourceInfo pushParentSourceInfo(InstanceProxy instance,
                                       BindingContext context)
        Records the source information of the given instance object as the new parent. The parent source information refers to an instance object (InstanceProxy) that triggered compilation of a child module. It will be added as the parent of every source information created while compiling the child module.
        Parameters:
        instance - Instance referring to a child being compiled.
        context - Binding context for variable in the instance.
        Returns:
        The source information record used as the parent.
        See Also:
        ModuleInstanceCompiler

      • popParentSourceInfo

        public void popParentSourceInfo()
        Removes the current parent source information record. This method assigns the parent of the current parent as the new parent.
        See Also:
        pushParentSourceInfo()

      • raise

        public void raise(EvalException exception)
           throws EvalException
        Signals that a compilation error occurred.

        The exception's location is adjusted if source information is enabled.

        If multiple exceptions are enabled, and the exception is not an abort exception, then the exception is logged and the method returns normally. Otherwise, the exception is thrown.

        Calling this method with the MultiEvalException of this instance is permitted and has no effect.

        Parameters:
        exception - The compilation exception.
        Throws:
        EvalException - if multiple exception are disabled.

      • raiseInVisitor

        public void raiseInVisitor(EvalException exception)
                    throws VisitorException
        Same as raise(EvalException), but if the exception is thrown it is wrapped in a VisitorException.
        Parameters:
        exception - The compilation exception.
        Throws:
        VisitorException - if multiple exception are disabled.
        See Also:
        raise(EvalException)

      • hasExceptions

        public boolean hasExceptions()
        Tests whether there is any exception accumulated in the list mExceptions.
        Returns:
        true if there is any accumulated exception, or false otherwise.

      • getExceptions

        public MultiEvalException getExceptions()
        Returns the MultiEvalException containing all the exceptions that occurred so far.
        Returns:
        The MultiEvalException, or null if multiple exceptions are disabled.

      • setExceptions

        public void setExceptions(MultiEvalException exceptions)
        Sets the MultiEvalException containing all the exceptions that occurred so far.
        Parameters:
        exceptions - The new MultiEvalException to use, or null to disable multiple exceptions.

      • dump

        public void dump(StringBuilder builder)
